examples.jmdp

Class MultiItems

  • java.lang.Object
    • jmarkov.jmdp.MDP<S,A>
      • jmarkov.jmdp.InfiniteMDP<S,A>
        • jmarkov.jmdp.DTMDP<examples.jmdp.MultiItemState,examples.jmdp.MultiItemOrder>
          • examples.jmdp.MultiItems

  • public class MultiItems
extends DTMDP<examples.jmdp.MultiItemState,examples.jmdp.MultiItemOrder>
    This file models a multi item inventory problem. The demands are random and independent in between them, with Poisson distribution with means "lambda[]".
    Author:
    Andres Sarmiento, Germán Riaño - Universidad de Los Andes

          double[] backOrderCost)
        Parameters:
        initSet -
        maxInventory - Capacity
        maxItemsPerOrder - maximum mumber of items per order
        typesOfItems - starting in 0. indicates the maximum index of the types.
        maxBackorders - Capacity
        K - Fixed cost per Order
        cost - variable cost
        price - variable cost
        h - percentual cost of holding inventory
        holdingCost - holding cost per item per period.
        theta - means of the Poisson demands per stage
        backOrderCost - cost incurred when there is no

    • Method Detail

      • reachable

        public States<examples.jmdp.MultiItemState> reachable(examples.jmdp.MultiItemState i,
                                             examples.jmdp.MultiItemOrder a)
        This function initializes all the possible states. Starts by creating all the possible states with total inventoty in 0 and iterates over the possible total inventories. For each, it iterates growing the number of backorders for the positions with no inventory.
        Specified by:
        reachable in class DTMDP<examples.jmdp.MultiItemState,examples.jmdp.MultiItemOrder>
        Parameters:
        i - Current State
        a - Action taken
        Returns:
        The reachable states.
